text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with miracle fudge that's right
people that know me know I'm not prone
to exaggeration or hyperbole sorry I had
to clear my throat grab my collar but
anyway here I think it's perfectly
appropriate to call this miracle fudge
because of how it's made believe it or
not this is 100% vegan but despite not
having any of those traditional fudge
ingredients in this it is absolutely
delicious and that whether your
recipient is a vegan or not would make a
beautiful beautiful holiday gift so
first thing we're going to need some
very high quality cocoa I'm using
something called cocoa Rouge and I
believe this is a Dutch process cocoa
which I have no idea what that means but
I'm a fan of the Dutch so I'm sure
that's a good thing and when you're
measuring this just don't scoop it out
with your cup very much like flour cocoa
can compress so I want you to spoon it
in and level it off and why am I using a
rounded spoon to level it's a good
question but anyway we're going to
measure out some cocoa we're going to
put that in a mixing bowl and then to
that we're going to add our sweetening
agent which in this case is maple syrup
and I've heard that using maple syrup to
sweeten things is nominally better than
using white sugar so that's good so some
maple syrup we're also going to give it
a couple drops of vanilla just a couple
drops and then a pinch of salt oh you
know we like a little pinch of salt in
our chocolate desserts makes everything
more chocolaty proven scientific fact
and at that point we're ready to
introduce these secrets and most
important ingredient coconut oil and as
you can see I'm not using an extra
virgin raw coconut oil I'm using a
refined coconut oil which works better
in this and we'll talk about the health
benefits on the blog and why I'm using
this one and what the difference is
between this and the extra virgin but
for now forget all that and what we need
to do because this stuff is solid at
room temperature we're going to stick
this in a bowl of hot water for a few
minutes
apparently the atoms in here are going
to vibrate a little quicker and it's
going to change States from solid to
liquid which will allow us to pour this
to measure and add that to our Bowl and
we're going to take a spatula or whisk
and we're going to stir that up and as
you stir you're going to be like man
that looks awesome it looks like a
beautiful shiny hot fudge sauce but
don't get too excited
because as you stir for a few more
seconds that coconut oil is going to
cool down and it's going to solidify
again and you're going to have something
that looks fairly grainy and ugly but
don't worry
completely normal because we have one
more very important step we're going to
very lightly toast some chopped up
walnuts and we're not going to go too
far here we're simply going to get the
walnuts to the point where they're
fragrant and hopped and how will you
know well first of all you're going to
smell and your nose will send messages

can also test by grabbing one and
potentially burning your fingers kids
don't do this so I plucked one out and
yes it was fragrant and hot so at that
point we're going to turn off the heat
we're going to let that cool down for
about a minute we don't want it to super
hot we just want it very very warm so
just stare at it for a minute and then
dump it into the bowl and start to stir
with your spatula and what's going to
happen is the heat from those nuts is
going to reel iqua fie that coconut oil
and you're going to be back to that
super glossy awesome looking chocolate
ganache type mixture but as we learned a

it's going to tighten up again so before
it does we want to pour this into our

and super easy to work with and of
course if you don't have silicone molds
or trades simply pour it in a plastic
lined pan like regular fudge
chill it and cut it it'll totally work

anyway ignore that last step we're

also so we're going to scrape the excess

then once that's cleaned up we're going

to pop that in the freezer until it's

only is this miracle fudge it's super
